sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a trapezium.
message_1: A trapezium has a length of one of its parallel sides as 10 cm, the other parallel side as 16 cm, and both the non-parallel sides as 8 cm each. Find the perimeter of the trapezium.
message_2:
To find the perimeter of the trapezium, we simply need to add the lengths of all its sides.

Perimeter = length of first parallel side + length of second parallel side + length of first non-parallel side + length of second non-parallel side

Perimeter = 10 cm + 16 cm + 8 cm + 8 cm

Perimeter = 42 cm

The perimeter of the trapezium is 42 cm.
